title: Union Budget 2017: Budget 2017: 7 measures to enable digital economy - Times of India
text:
1. Aadhar Pay , a merchant version of Aadhaar-enabled payment system, will be launched shortly for those without debit cards, mobile phones or e-wallets. 

2. On the recommendation of a Special Investigation Team on Black Money, finance minister Arun Jaitley announced that no transaction above Rs 3 lakh will be permitted in cash. 

3. The government will launch two new schemes to promote the use of BHIM. These are referral bonus schemes for individuals and cashless schemes for merchants. 

4. A mission will be set up with a target of over 2,500 crore digital transactions for 2017-18 through UPI , USSD , Aadhaar Pay, IMPS and debit cards. 

5. To promote cashless transactions, the government decided to remove all duties on point of sale devices, finger print readers and similar devices. 

6. Banks have targeted to introduce additional 10 lakh Point-of-Sale terminals by March 2017. 

7. Political parties will be entitled to receive donations by cheque or in the digital mode from their donors.
